title:
Strichartz estimates for the Schr\"odinger equation on compact manifolds
  with nonpositive sectional curvature
authors: Xiaoqi Huang and Christopher D. Sogge
abstract:
We obtain improved Strichartz estimates for solutions of the Schr\"odinger
equation on compact manifolds with nonpositive sectional curvatures which are
related to the classical universal results of Burq, G\'erard and Tzvetkov [11].
More explicitly, we are able refine the arguments in the recent work of Blair
and the authors [3] to obtain no-loss $L^p_tL^{q}_{x}$-estimates on intervals
of length $\log \lambda\cdot \lambda^{-1} $ for all {\em admissible} pairs
$(p,q)$ when the initial data have frequencies comparable to $\lambda$, which,
given the role of the Ehrenfest time, is the natural analog in this setting of
the universal results in [11]. We achieve this log-gain over the universal
estimates by applying the Keel-Tao theorem along with improved global kernel
estimates for microlocalized operators which exploit the geometric assumptions.
